column4: i have samba installed allready how do i know if its running i know sounds dumb
sudo stop smbd && sudo restart nmbd && sudo start nmbd
so you have a samba share on Ubuntu which you want to access from windows?
I cannot see any shares in there. That file is huge btw, you may want to write one from scratch.
But just adding the share to the bottom should get it working
did you do that before or after you sent the pastebin?
well it isn't in the config file so it won't work. I suggest renaming that one as original and using one I give you
yes, do you own the folder and have read/write permissions?
sorry, i meant the folder you want to share
http://paste.ubuntu.com/553425/  add the Back-Up section and add the lines in global to current global section
you can turn off the folder options are aswell
yeah that is all you need for a working samba config (more than actually :))
then check it with, sudo testparm
vista box needs to join workgroup: WORKGROUP, then reboot and wait upto 5 minutes for share to be visible.
